TopicTitle: Gimme ideas for Heavy Lifters or landers with rovers?

Articles.Content:
I'm currently planning to fly to Dres,but I'm outta ideas.Everything I always do is glue some asparagus staging,sometimes double (like snowflake),with some boosters D:

If you guys have some heavy lifters designs,or landers with probe rovers attached to them,post some pics here pleaseee

why landers with probe rovers? Imagine- You land,place flag,jump around with jeb,then undock a probe rover from lander bottom and fly back home.Then,you can enjoy the planet with a rover! No need of two missions for it.

EDIT: rocket can contain the need of refilling in ~300km orbit.(I have a space station there with senior and normal docking ports).

Edited August 28, 2013 by JiWint
Try building an onion rocket and a smaller payload. Or better, build a serial rocket and watch the lower stages get blasted by the upper! (That is always fun to watch)

Try building an onion rocket and a smaller payload. Or better, build a serial rocket and watch the lower stages get blasted by the upper! (That is always fun to watch)

Isn't the Shrek rocket is less effective than asparagus?
If you want efficiency, asparagus is best, but you said you wanted an alternative.

If you want efficiency, asparagus is best, but you said you wanted an alternative.

I didn't write the word "alternative",I only need a heavy lifting rocket ^^
Do you want a lander or a lifter?

Do you want a lander or a lifter?

I'd like to see as much as possible lifters designs. But if someone has made a lander with "built-in" probe rover,I'll watch it too!

I have a Robotic rover/lander and a manned robotic rover/lander. They are originally designed for Duna, but considering Dres has a much lower gravity they should be more than capable of landing and returning.

Robotic Rover

Thread: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/45907-Robotic-rock-sampler

Manned Robotic Rover

Thread: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/47650-Dune-Bike-Dune-Chaser

Let me know if they tickle your fancy

I think I found a cool use for the first one,(building bases) but that second one remembers me "Tron"

Is it alright if the launcher has around 300 parts and will either abuse or utilize part-clipping depending on your opinions of it. If so, I will post pictures and put it here.

Spica

Is it alright if the launcher has around 300 parts and will either abuse or utilize part-clipping depending on your opinions of it. If so, I will post pictures and put it here.

Spica

all rocket designs are welcome

Here's my heavy lifter:

3 orange tanks stacked on a mainsail, 4 side separators, two stacked orange tanks with mainsails on those separator. Each outer orange stack has 3 seperators with a large solid rocket booster on top.

It's fairly capable, but you'll have to experiment with a lot of struts to get it flying.

I'd like to see as much as possible lifters designs. But if someone has made a lander with "built-in" probe rover,I'll watch it too!

was the first mun lander.

Here's one that I use:

You want the part below the lower separator. Everything else was garbage, but the lift vehicle is solid. That's 3 of the Rockomax X200-32 fuel tanks in the center stack. You will have to arrange the staging so that the lower SRBs fire first, then eject and fire the next set etc. I have a larger one that is capable of very heavy launches, but I don't have a picture. The aerodynamic parts can change depending on what your payload is.

was the first mun lander.

First mun lander? Whoah

It's awesome! ^.^ How did you take that rover too?
If your looking for launchers to use, check the two links in my sig for some of my standard launchers. (Especially my Jool A-2 in my Zwei Bruder family, it has a metrictruckton of dV).
